intro: Pedicularis omiiana, commonly known as the Himalayan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its spurred flowers, which are typically pink or purple in color. It grows in rocky and alpine environments, often in areas with poor soil conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
